label: Project Broker
info:
# Receive Projects
The Broker receives incoming parsed projects from the Parsers and updates the project index.

# Keep Lists
The Broker updates the index (/all) with new projectes from the Parsers.

# Receive Commands
## All
Return all projects in the index

## $n
Return $n or all projects

## Latest
Return 10 latest projects

## Subscribe
Subscribe to the Bot and receive new Projects as they're being parsed




##

devops-projects.de
template:
DevOps Projects

an interactive DevOps Board

Projects Resources

What is this?

DevOps Projects is an information Broker inspired by HackerNews. It currently features DevOps Jobs and additional Resources like Tools, Repositories, Frameworks, Methodologies and anything else that adds to the overall topic.

Like HackerNews, it's all about brokering URLs to useful content and heavily relies on user contribution. Unlike HackerNews (and more in the spirit of DevOps and portability), one of the goals of the project is to ease access and the submission workflow by implementing unified modern endpoints for submission and consumption, like:

  • DONE Slack
  • DONE Telegram
  • TODO REST API
  • TODO RSS
  • PLANNED Websocket
  • PLANNED Facebook Messenger

Sharing a useful DevOps Resource is as easy as submitting the Link to the respective Endpoint. In the simplest case this means sharing a single URL with the Slack or Telegram Bot.

You can subscribe to DevOps Projects through the following channels:

Telegram

Once you talk to the Bot, use /start to see your options.

This site has been served {{access_log}} times. {{messages_sent}} messages have been sent to Subscribers.

func:
msg.payload = "Driving time to work is " + msg.payload.rows[0].elements[0].duration_in_traffic.text.replace("mins","minutes");

return msg;

name: Parse data
Parse data
Parse data
func:
msg.payload = "Driving time to work is " + msg.payload.work + ", and to Heathrow T5 is " + msg.payload.airport;

return msg;

name: Get travel time
info:
This flow uses the travel distance API to get the 
travel time in between to places.

name: Get multiple travel times
info:
This flow is similar to the above, but executes
two queries for two different routes and later 
combines the results to one single message.

name: Next tram
info:
This flow uses the directions API to get directions
data and in this case using public transport.
Unfortunately this cannot be used to get a 
timetable of a stop showing future arrivals
but can be used to get the next bus/tram
arriving at a particular stop.

name: Parse data
func:
msg.payload = "Next tram is number " + msg.payload.routes[0].legs[0].steps[0].transit_details.line.short_name + " leaving at " + msg.payload.routes[0].legs[0].steps[0].transit_details.departure_time.text;

return msg;

payload: IT-Operations: Monitoring & DevOps Spezialist  Aufgaben:  Der Monitoring & DevOps Spezialist ist verantwortlich fr die Untersttzung von IT Operations Team mittels effektivem Monitoring/Metriken, Event Management Lsungen und professioneller CD-Pipelines. Der Monitoring & DevOps Spezialist agiert Teambergreifend und ist fr den Aufbau der CI-Tools, die berwachung der Applikationsinfrastruktur, den Diensten sowie abgebildeten Prozessen verantwortlich.  * Design, Implementierung und Anpassung des Applikationsmonitorings sowie der Event bzw. Alert Management Prozesse * Entwerfen konsolidierter Ansichten fr IT-Operations und Supporteinheiten * Integration neuer Monitoring Technologien in bestehende Infrastrukturen * Bereitstellung entsprechender Filter, Metriken und Dashboards zur Untersttzung des Applikationsmonitoring * Bereitstellung von Eventlogging fr root cause analysen und Prvention von Incidents, Problems und Qualittsproblemen * Automatisierung der Daily Health Checks mit entsprechendem Alerting * Aus- und Aufbau der Continuous Integration Platformen * Teilen der Arbeitsergebnisse mit Entwicklungs-, Betriebs- sowie DevOps-Teams    Anforderungen:  * Vertraut mit Themen wie Continuous Integration, Configuration Management * Kenntnisse in der Betriebssystemwelt Linux / Unix sowie vertraut mit Scripting und Scriptsprachen (z.B. Perl, Python, bash) * Gute Kenntnisse in Monitoring Technologien wie time-series DBs, metric dashboards, real-time graphing * Erfahrung mit Tools wie AppDynamics, Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana (ELK), Kafka, Grafana, Splunk, Liquibase, Flyway, kubernetes, * HELM, docker, Jenkins, Ansible, Puppet * Gutes Verstndnis von Cloud-Umgebungen, Enterprise Application * Architecture und Web-Scale Technologien * Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift * Kommunikativ in groen Projektumfelden sowie Service- und Kundenorientierung * Teamplayer, berzeugungskraft und hohe Eigeninitiative, die nur wenig Anleitung bentigt * Gute Anpassungsfhigkeit in einer schnelllebigen Umgebung
